page.title: 13HISTORY
page.content:
Thurlstone retains some original weavers cottages with mullioned windows on the upper storey. (These supplied the upstairs room with sufficient light for the weaver to weave by, in the days when weaving was a cottage industry.
Thurlstone appears in the original Domesday book as {TURULFESTON.}Before 1066 it containd valuable land but 13 years later it was lying useless. However by 1379, Thurlstone was three times the size of Penistone. Some people surmize that its population was later reduced by the Plague.
